column2: Q1. What grade is your child in?
column3: Q2. Does your child have a cell phone?
column4: Q3. At what age did your child get their first smartphone (with apps and can access the internet)?
column5: Q4. What type of phone does your child use?
column6: Q5. Do they bring their phone to school?
column7:
Q6. During a typical school day, how many times a day do you contact your child by phone (e.g., text messages, phone calls)?

Number of times per day:
column8: Q7. When you have conflicts with your child, how often are they related to their cell phone use? (e.g., screen time, boundaries, or access)
column9: Q8. Do you feel you can reach your child in a timely manner during the school day when needed?
column10: Q9. In the past four weeks, how often has your child displayed the following behaviors? [Acted defiant or resistant to rules]
column11: Q9. In the past four weeks, how often has your child displayed the following behaviors? [Was easily distracted]
column12: Q9. In the past four weeks, how often has your child displayed the following behaviors? [Did not pay attention when directly spoken to]
column13: Q9. In the past four weeks, how often has your child displayed the following behaviors? [Rushed through tasks in order to get back to their phone]
column14: Q9. In the past four weeks, how often has your child displayed the following behaviors? [Slept with their phone in bedroom]

Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your child’s teacher.
(If your child has multiple teachers, please consider the one your family interacts with most frequently.) [We have a close and mutually respectful relationship.]
column16:
Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your child’s teacher.
(If your child has multiple teachers, please consider the one your family interacts with most frequently.) [I feel that the teacher pays attention to my suggestions and concerns.]
column17:
Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your child’s teacher.
(If your child has multiple teachers, please consider the one your family interacts with most frequently.) [My child's teacher is doing good things for my child.]
column18: Q11. In the last month, how often have you experienced the following?  [I’ve felt that I’m unable to control important aspects of my child’s safety while they’re at school.​]
column19: Q11. In the last month, how often have you experienced the following?  [I’ve felt nervous or stressed about not being able to communicate with my child during school hours.​]
column20: Q11. In the last month, how often have you experienced the following?  [I’ve felt confident in my ability to handle parenting challenges.]
column21: Q12. Please share any other thoughts you have about the phone policy at your child’s school.
column22: Q13. Is there anything else you want to share with us?
column23: Q14. What is your relationship to the child whose school is administering this survey?
column24: Q15. With which racial/ethnic groups do you identify? You can select more than one.
column25: Q16. What is the highest level of education you have completed?
column26: Q1. Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your child’s behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] … [My child seems to be able to focus better.]
column27: Q1. Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your child’s behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] … [My child has used their phone more before and after school.]
column28: Q1. Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your child’s behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] … [My child seems to be in a better mood.]
column29: Q1. Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your child’s behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] … [Nothing has really changed for my child.]
